Package games.negative.alumina.menu

Class PaginatedMenu

java.lang.Object
games.negative.alumina.menu.PaginatedMenu
All Implemented Interfaces:
InteractiveMenu
public abstract class PaginatedMenu extends Object implements InteractiveMenu
A paginated menu that can be used to display a large number of items in a Chest Menu environment.

  • Constructor Details

    • PaginatedMenu

      public PaginatedMenu(@NotNull @NotNull String title, int rows)
      Represents a paginated menu with a title and specified number of rows. The menu uses a Bukkit inventory to display buttons and listings.

    • PaginatedMenu

      public PaginatedMenu()
      Represents a paginated menu with a title and specified number of rows. The menu uses a Bukkit inventory to display buttons and listings.

    • refresh

      public void refresh(@NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      Refreshes the inventory of the menu for the specified player. This method clears the inventory and populates it with updated buttons and listings.
      Specified by:
      refresh in interface InteractiveMenu
      Parameters:
      player - The player for whom to refresh the inventory. Must not be null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the player parameter is null.

    • setRows

      public void setRows(int rows)
      Sets the number of rows in the menu.
      Parameters:
      rows - The number of rows to set. Must be between MIN_ROWS and MAX_ROWS.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the rows value is not between MIN_ROWS and MAX_ROWS.

      Parameters:

    • changePage

      public void changePage(org.bukkit.entity.Player player, int page)
      Changes the page of the menu for the specified player.
      Parameters:
      player - The player for whom to change the page. Must not be null.
      page - The new page number. Must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to the total number of pages.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the page is less than or equal to 0 or greater than the total number of pages.
      NullPointerException - if the player parameter is null.
